com.jbion.puzzle.model

Class Puzzle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Cube>
          • com.jbion.puzzle.model.Puzzle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Cube>, Collection<Cube>, List<Cube>, RandomAccess

    public class Puzzle
extends ArrayList<Cube>
    A list of placed Cubes, used to solve the puzzle.
    Author:
    Joffrey Bion
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Adds the specified Cube to this Puzzle.
        Specified by:

      • remove

        public void remove(Cube c)
        Removes the specified Cube from this Puzzle.
        Parameters:
        c - The Cube to remove.

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect()
        Returns whether this Puzzle is in an acceptable state. A state is acceptable if there is no cube overlap, and the whole Puzzle is contained in a 3x3x3 cube.
        Returns:
        true if this Puzzle is in an acceptable state.

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Returns whether this Puzzle has reached its full size.
        Returns:
        true if all cubes has been added to this Puzzle.

      • getNextPossibleCubes

        public List<Cube> getNextPossibleCubes()
        Returns a list of the possible cubes to add to this Puzzle, depending on its current state. The returned cubes are the possibilities respecting this Puzzle's link constraints.
        This does not deal with overlaps and overshoots of the Puzzle's bounds. In other words, if a Cube from this list is added, isCorrect() might return false.
        Returns:
        A list of the possible cubes to add to this Puzzle.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractCollection<Cube>
